intro: Thalictrum henricksonii, commonly known as the Henrickson's meadow rue, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Thalictrum henricksonii is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
